intro: Astragalus nigrolineatus, commonly known as blackline milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Astragalus nigrolineatus is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil.
